timeline_size: With this function you can get the total number of active moments for a timeline (an "active" moment is one which has code or DnD™ added to it). This can be handy when creating dynamic timelines using the timeline_moment_add_script() and timeline_moment_clear() functions, as you can check to see if a given timeline has the correct number of active moments or none at all.
The index of the timeline get the information from.

The above code check the given timeline size, and if it returns 0 (ie: the timeline has no active moments) it will add a script function to be used at a random moment within the timeline indexed in the global variable "tl".
